channel.title: Internal exception java.net.socketexception connection
channel.description: I've searched a few times to fix this error, but I have been unable to find a solution. This error started occurring after telemisthebest started spawn killing me, and someone else decided to destroy the house (griefing report being made). After this incident, I cannot login to the server with my windows or my mac partition (using a mac). I have redownloaded minecraft on both windows and mac, and even redownloaded java, but the same error continually occurs. Anyone have any way to solve this problem without me completely rebooting my computer?

item.title: Internal exception java.net.socketexception connection
item.dc:creator: @XxJtxX XxJtxX
item.description:
@XxJtxX wrote:

http://www.mediafire.com/?e6zw6la6f72rm96 Replace your minecraft.jar with this to play version 1.4

Read full topic

item.description:
@Scape-JAVA wrote:

Try updating your network adapter drivers.

item.title: Internal exception java.net.socketexception connection
item.dc:creator: @Sonjai Sonjai
item.description:
@Sonjai wrote:

Are you using the latest version? That could be the problem, as moparcraft hasn’t upgraded yet. You’ll have to downgrade to 1.4

Read full topic
